Heboh Anggaran Janggal, Kepala Bappeda DKI Juga Mundur
01 Nov 2019, 09:59 by Imam Hamdi, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Daerah DKI Jakarta Sri Mahendra mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya, Kamis, 1 November 2019. Mahendra mengundurkan diri pada Kamis malam, 31 Oktober 2019, di tengah heboh anggaran janggal yang membekap Pemerintahan Gubernur Anies Baswedan.
"Seperti diketahui situasi kondisi saat ini yang tentunya membutuhkan kinerja pemerintah yang lebih baik, saya mengajukan pengunduran diri supaya akselerasi Bappeda akan lebih ditingkatkan. Makasih," kata Mahendra di Balai Kota DKI, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan menjawabnya dengan menyatakan apresiasi atas kinerja yang telah diberikan Mahendra sejak ditunjuk menjabat Kepala Bappeda awal tahun ini. Mengaku terkejut, Anies menyatakan telah menerima pengunduran diri anak buahnya itu. "Makasih atas kinerja dia," ujar mantan menteri pendidikan dan kebudayaan itu.
Anies mengatakan menghargai keputusan Mahendra ketika memilih mundur dan memberi kesempatan kepada orang lain. Posisi Mahendra akan digantikan sementara oleh Deputi Gubernur Bidang Pengendalian Penduduk dan Permukiman Suharti, bekas perencana Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan di Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Nasional.
Kepala Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan Edi Juanedi sebelumnya juga telah menyatakan mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya. "Mengundurkan diri atas permintaan sendiri, Per tanggal 31," ujar Kepala Badan Kepegawaian Daerah DKI Chaidir saat dihubungi, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Dua pejabat teras DKI ini mundur di tengah kesibukan DKI menyusun APBD 2020 yang mendekati tenggat. Penyusunan diwarnai sisir ulang setelah sejumlah rencana kegiatan di Kebijakan Umum Anggaran PPAS dinilai janggal bahkan tak masuk akal.
Termasuk yang diungkap di Dinas Pariwisata tentang anggaran Rp5 miliar untuk menyewa jasa lima influencer asing di media sosial. "Jadi perlu saya luruskan bahwa Rp 5 miliar itu bukan untuk 5 influencer, tapi ada juga kegiatan-kegiatannya," kata Edi dalam penjelasannya sebelum kemudian rencana kegiatan itu dihapus.
Selain anggaran influencer, plafon anggaran janggal lainnya ditemukan di Dinas Pendidikan berupa pembelian lem aibon senilai Rp82 miliar dan Rp123 miliar untuk pembelian pulpen. Anggaran lem aibon telah dipastikan dihapus lagi.

Splashy Budgetary, Head of DKI Bappeda Also Retreated
01 Nov 2019, 09:59 by Imam Hamdi, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Head of the DKI Jakarta Regional Development Planning Board Sri Mahendra resigned from his post on Thursday, November 1, 2019. Mahendra resigned on Thursday night, October 31, 2019, amid an awkward budget chaos that was hammering Governor Anies Baswedan's Government.
"As we know the current situation that certainly requires better government performance, I propose resignation so that the acceleration of Bappeda will be further improved. Thank you," Mahendra said at the City Hall on Friday, November 1, 2019.
DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan responded by expressing appreciation for the performance Mahendra had given since he was appointed Head of Bappeda earlier this year. Claiming to be surprised, Anies claimed to have accepted the resignation of his men. "Thanks for his performance," said the former minister of education and culture.
Anies said that he appreciated Mahendra's decision when he chose to resign and gave opportunities to others. Mahendra's position will be temporarily replaced by Deputy Governor for Population and Settlement Control Suharti, a former planner of the Ministry of Education and Culture at the National Development Planning Agency.
Head of Tourism and Culture Office Edi Juanedi had previously also said he had resigned from his post. "Resigned at his own request, as of 31st," said the Head of the DKI Jakarta Regional Civil Service Agency when contacted on Friday, November 1, 2019.
The two top ranking officials of DKI resigned in the midst of DKI's busy schedule of preparing the 2020 budget which is approaching the deadline. The preparation was re-colored after a number of planned activities in the General Policy of the PPAS Budget were considered odd or even absurd.
Including what was revealed in the Tourism Office about the Rp5 billion budget to hire the services of five foreign influencers on social media. "So I need to clarify that the Rp 5 billion is not for 5 influencers, but there are also activities," Edi said in his explanation before the plan was later removed.
In addition to the influencer budget, another odd budget ceiling was found at the Education Office in the form of the purchase of Rp.8 billion aibon glue and Rp123 billion for the purchase of pens. The budget of the aibon glue has certainly been removed again.
